column1: '''''Twenty years have flowed away''''' is the opening line of a poem recited by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] during his [[1958]] Rotterdam speech. Tolkien gave a [[Quenya]] rendering of the poem, which is planned for publication sometime in the autumn of [[2014]].<ref>{{webcite
column4: articlename=J.R.R. Tolkien Reveals TRUE Meaning Of 'The Lord Of The Rings' In Unearthed Audio Recording

column1: ''Twenty years have flowed away down the long river''
''And never in my life will return for me from the sea.''
